The co-op experience, which should‚Äôve been the game‚Äôs highlight, is completely unreliable ‚Äî my friend kept getting disconnected from my session every 10‚Äì15 minutes. The world itself feels empty and lifeless, like there‚Äôs nothing meaningful to do after a while. Even when I finished every side quest for a community, the legacy missions took forever to appear. Sometimes I waited ages just for the next mission to trigger, which made the pacing unbearable.

Well the game is far too easy on anything other than lethal. So fo anyone who is new or isn't the best at survival or management? This game is worth the price and then some. But lethal? Is just one of the worst more frustrating experiences I have ever had gaming. The issue isn't with the amount of plague hearts or literally anything that lethal adds and changes, the issue? The combat. This game is clunky and unfair. The amount of times i have died or lost everything due to something that I could have done nothing to prevent is staggering, I had to resort to cheesing the game whenever even the slightest thing didn't go my way. So what makes everything so unfair and clunky? Well it's truely just one simple little thing, unavoidable attacks. It happens so often and in more ways than I can count, just playing this game when every scratch can result in either death or a huge cost to resources (at least early game huge) makes it so much more apparent when it does happen. Doing anything just becomes a chore when knowing you can't outplay or plan to avoid a threat that can just cheat you of everything. You can't even rely on stealth completly for so many reasons but mainly when taking out plague hearts because it can literally spawn zombies in, not that in itself is an issue. TLDR: if you haven't played the game before? Pick it up, it's fun and a cool zombie game take, just don't expect much in the way of a story. ‚≠ê‚≠ê Mediocre & probably worse.

State of Decay 2‚Äôs multiplayer system feels like an afterthought slapped onto an otherwise decent survival game. Instead of enhancing the experience, co-op ends up restricting it. As a client player, you‚Äôre essentially a guest with your hands tied. You can‚Äôt meaningfully progress your own community, you can‚Äôt build, you can‚Äôt manage, and you‚Äôre constantly leashed to the host‚Äôs map. It‚Äôs co-op in name only.

Not to mention the unforgiving restricted access from playing with friends in mulitplayer, requiring both Steam, Xbox AND a Microsoft account just to simply get into a game with a friend. It's impractical and unethical.

The tethering system is another problem. You‚Äôre forced to stay close to the host, killing any sense of freedom or tactical play. Want to split up to scavenge efficiently? Forget it. Step too far, and the game yanks you back like a dog on a chain.

The worst part? The whole setup feels like wasted potential. A zombie survival sandbox should thrive in multiplayer, but State of Decay 2‚Äôs system instead punishes you for wanting to play with friends. Instead of building something together, the host gets all the progress while everyone else just tags along for scraps.

Multiplayer should elevate a survival game, sadly it drags it down.

I want to say that this is not a completely fair review, I don't think this game has no worth and should be completely avoided, I personally have sunk so many hours in both the first and second game on console, so then why don't I recommened it now? Well the game is far too easy on anything other than lethal. So fo anyone who is new or isn't the best at survival or management? This game is worth the price and then some. But lethal? Is just one of the worst more frustrating experiences I have ever had gaming. The issue isn't with the amount of plague hearts or literally anything that lethal adds and changes, the issue? The combat. This game is clunky and unfair. The amount of times i have died or lost everything due to something that I could have done nothing to prevent is staggering, I had to resort to cheesing the game whenever even the slightest thing didn't go my way. So what makes everything so unfair and clunky? Well it's truely just one simple little thing, unavoidable attacks. It happens so often and in more ways than I can count, just playing this game when every scratch can result in either death or a huge cost to resources (at least early game huge) makes it so much more apparent when it does happen. Doing anything just becomes a chore when knowing you can't outplay or plan to avoid a threat that can just cheat you of everything. You can't even rely on stealth completly for so many reasons but mainly when taking out plague hearts because it can literally spawn zombies in, not that in itself is an issue. So if it wasn't for how clunky the game is I would be fine with EVERYTHING else, even the curveballs which can make killing a zombie explode and kill you instsantly. If I could rely on my own ability I wouldn't care at all, there have been many time that my own missteps have cost me greatly and you know what? I was fine with that, I didn't mind it because it was my fault. 
TLDR: if you haven't played the game before? Pick it up, it's fun and a cool zombie game take, just don't expect much in the way of a story. But whatever you do, don't play lethal, it's not a test of skill but of patience and luck. Unless I am missing something, maybe I have to cap the fps and everything is fixed, since I have no idea why people play lethal.
